verses._note: Verse 1.1 - Opening verse of the Gita
verses.sanskrit: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच । धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः । मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ॥
verses.transliteration: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca | dharma-kṣetre kuru-kṣetre samavetā yuyutsavaḥ | māmakāḥ pāṇḍavāś caiva kim akurvata sañjaya ||
verses.hindi: धृतराष्ट्र बोले – हे संजय! धर्मभूमि कुरुक्षेत्र में एकत्रित हुए युद्ध की इच्छा वाले मेरे और पाण्डु के पुत्रों ने क्या किया?
verses.english: Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjaya, what did my people and the sons of Pandu do when they assembled in the holy land of Kurukshetra, eager to fight?
verses.principle: Setting the stage for the great teaching; the battlefield as metaphor for inner conflict

verses._note: Verse 2.47 - The most famous karma yoga verse
verses.sanskrit: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन । मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि ॥
verses.transliteration: karmaṇy-evādhikāras te mā phaleṣu kadācana | mā karma-phala-hetur bhūr mā te saṅgo 'stv-akarmaṇi ||
verses.hindi: तेरा कर्म करने में ही अधिकार है, उसके फलों में कभी नहीं। इसलिए तू कर्मों के फल का हेतु मत बन और तेरी कर्म न करने में भी आसक्ति न हो।
verses.english: You have a right to perform your prescribed duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits of your actions. Never consider yourself to be the cause of the results of your activities, nor be attached to inaction.
verses.principle: Perform your duty without attachment to results (Nishkama Karma - desireless action)

verses.transliteration: duḥkheṣv-anudvigna-manāḥ sukheṣu vigata-spṛhaḥ | vīta-rāga-bhaya-krodhaḥ sthita-dhīr munir ucyate ||
verses.hindi: जिसका मन दुःखों में उद्विग्न नहीं होता और सुखों में स्पृहारहित है, जिसके राग, भय और क्रोध नष्ट हो गए हैं, ऐसा मुनि स्थितप्रज्ञ कहा जाता है।
verses.english: One whose mind is not disturbed in the midst of sorrows, who is free from longing for pleasures, and from whom attachment, fear, and anger have departed—such a sage is said to be of steady wisdom.
verses.principle: True wisdom is equanimity in pleasure and pain, free from attachment, fear, and anger

verses.sanskrit: उद्धरेदात्मनात्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् । आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः ॥
verses.transliteration: uddhared ātmanātmānaṃ nātmānam avasādayet | ātmaiva hy ātmano bandhur ātmaiva ripur ātmanaḥ ||
verses.hindi: अपने द्वारा अपना उद्धार करे और अपने को नीचे न गिराए, क्योंकि यह मनुष्य स्वयं ही अपना मित्र है और स्वयं ही अपना शत्रु है।
verses.english: One must elevate oneself by one's own mind, not degrade oneself. The mind is the friend of the conditioned soul, and his enemy as well.
verses.principle: You are responsible for your own upliftment; the self can be your greatest ally or worst enemy

verses._note: Verse 12.13 - Compassion and friendliness toward all
verses.sanskrit: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च । निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी ॥
verses.transliteration: adveṣṭā sarva-bhūtānāṃ maitraḥ karuṇa eva ca | nirmamo nirahaṅkāraḥ sama-duḥkha-sukhaḥ kṣamī ||
verses.hindi: जो सम्पूर्ण प्राणियों में द्वेष-रहित, मैत्री और करुणा से युक्त है, ममतारहित, अहंकाररहित, सुख-दुःख में सम और क्षमाशील है।
verses.english: One who is not envious but is a kind friend to all living entities, who does not think himself a proprietor and is free from false ego, who is equal in both happiness and distress, who is tolerant and forgiving.
verses.principle: The qualities of a true devotee include universal compassion, friendliness, and freedom from ego

verses._note: Verse 13.27 - Seeing the divine equally in all beings
verses.sanskrit: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् । विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति ॥
verses.transliteration: samaṃ sarveṣu bhūteṣu tiṣṭhantaṃ parameśvaram | vinaśyatsv avinaśyantaṃ yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati ||
verses.hindi: जो पुरुष नाशवान समस्त प्राणियों में नाशरहित सबके परमेश्वर को समभाव से स्थित देखता है, वही यथार्थ देखता है।
verses.english: One who sees the Supreme Lord dwelling equally in all beings, the imperishable within the perishable, truly sees.
verses.principle: True vision is seeing the divine presence equally in all beings, recognizing the eternal within the temporary

verses._note: Verse 15.7 - The eternal soul as fragment of the Divine
verses.sanskrit: ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूतः सनातनः । मनःषष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति ॥
verses.transliteration: mamaivāṃśo jīva-loke jīva-bhūtaḥ sanātanaḥ | manaḥ-ṣaṣṭhānīndriyāṇi prakṛti-sthāni karṣati ||
verses.hindi: इस संसार में जीवात्मा मेरा ही सनातन अंश है और वह प्रकृति में स्थित मन सहित छहों इन्द्रियों को अपनी ओर खींचता है।
verses.english: The living entities in this conditioned world are My eternal fragmental parts. Due to conditioned life, they are struggling very hard with the six senses, which include the mind.

word_meanings.जीव-लोके: in the world of conditioned souls

verses.principle: Every soul is an eternal fragment of the Divine, inherently connected to the Supreme

verses._note: Verse 16.1 - Divine qualities (first of three verses)
verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः । दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca | abhayaṃ sattva-saṃśuddhir jñāna-yoga-vyavasthitiḥ | dānaṃ damaś ca yajñaś ca svādhyāyas tapa ārjavam ||
verses.hindi: श्री भगवान बोले – अभय, अन्तःकरण की शुद्धि, ज्ञानयोग में दृढ़ स्थिति, दान, इन्द्रियों का दमन, यज्ञ, स्वाध्याय, तप और सरलता।
verses.english: The Supreme Lord said: Fearlessness, purification of one's existence, cultivation of spiritual knowledge, charity, self-control, sacrifice, study of the Vedas, austerity, and simplicity.
verses.principle: Divine qualities that lead to spiritual progress and mental well-being

verses._note: Verse 18.66 - The ultimate surrender verse (final teaching)
verses.sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज । अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः ॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-dharmān parityajya mām ekaṃ śaraṇaṃ vraja | ahaṃ tvāṃ sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣayiṣyāmi mā śucaḥ ||
verses.hindi: सम्पूर्ण धर्मों को अर्थात सम्पूर्ण कर्तव्य कर्मों को मुझमें त्यागकर तू केवल एक मुझ सर्वशक्तिमान, सर्वाधार परमेश्वर की ही शरण में आ जा। मैं तुझे सम्पूर्ण पापों से मुक्त कर दूंगा, तू शोक मत कर।
verses.english: Abandon all varieties of dharmas and just surrender unto Me alone. I shall deliver you from all sinful reactions. Do not fear.
verses.principle: Ultimate surrender to the Divine brings complete freedom from all anxieties and suffering

verses._note: Verse 18.78 - The final verse of the Gita (conclusion)
verses.sanskrit: यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः । तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिर्ध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम ॥
verses.transliteration: yatra yogeśvaraḥ kṛṣṇo yatra pārtho dhanur-dharaḥ | tatra śrīr vijayo bhūtir dhruvā nītir matir mama ||
verses.hindi: जहाँ योगेश्वर श्री कृष्ण हैं और जहाँ गाण्डीव-धनुषधारी अर्जुन है, वहीं श्री, विजय, विभूति और अचल नीति है – ऐसा मेरा मत है।
verses.english: Wherever there is Krishna, the master of yoga, and wherever there is Arjuna, the supreme archer, there will also certainly be opulence, victory, extraordinary power, and morality. That is my opinion.

word_meanings.धनुः-धरः: the carrier of the bow and arrow

verses.principle: Where divine wisdom (Krishna) and dedicated action (Arjuna) unite, success and righteousness are assured
